note.p: Career: Trained for the medical profession, but went to Australia in search of gold (1851); took up astronomy; founded a Government Observatory, Williamstown; Superintendent, Geodetic Survey of the Colony of Victoria (1858-1874); Government Astronomer, Melbourne (1863-1895);
Memberships: FRAS (1859); Royal Society of Victoria (President)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1909 vol 82 pp vi-x signed by H H T
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 2. After 1847' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 47-84
